subject: RE: [junit] Need example JUnit tests to validate Test Mentor's support of JUnit
msgSnippet: It depends. The tests are stand-alone Java classes, so you can execute them as part of your build. If you want the code coverage, the JPDA setup is currently
messageBody:
It depends. The tests are stand-alone Java classes, so you can execute them as part of your build. If you want the code coverage, the JPDA setup is currently managed from the GUI, but I'm sure we could make it command-line driven if somebody asked for it. The test generation (generate tests from Rose design models, or class relationships) part is also driven from a GUI. We are demand driven and very open to input, so if users indicated it would be helpful for various aspects to be controlled from the command line we are certainly open to adding that ability.
 

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

-----Original Message-----
From: mrettig@... [mailto:mrettig@...]
Sent: Wednesday, March 07, 2001 11:58 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] Need example JUnit tests to validate Test Mentor's support of JUnit


Michael Silverstein wrote:
>I threw together a screen capture to illustrate at:
>http://www.silvermark.com/evaluators/5.3result_junit.html

Is there a command line version, or an interactive API?

I would probably want to integrate this tool into the build process, so I need a way to automate the testing and results. That way I can become a build nazi, and notify the offending programmer every time he/she checks in code that is not tested.


Regards,

Mike
